TopicTitle: Poor Bill is stranded in the ocean... How do I save him?

Articles.Content:
Hello, I made an account to ask this question. I was testing a ship, and it just started to get into orbit when I knew it wouldn't make it on fuel. I turned back to Kerbin but I missed the station and landed a few kilometers out in the ocean! Bill is standing on top of the floating fuel tank, but I have no idea how to rescue him. My game is vanilla as far as I know.

Any help is appreciated... I don't want him to die!

Actually, if you go to the tracking station, Find bill in your list of active flights (If you have a bunch, right click the Kerbal looking icon along the top), then click recover and/or terminate.

by the way, Kerbals don't die of starvation, they can only die of being crushed or smashed into things at high velocities, even if they do, they will magically reappear in your astronaut list after a short time.
Tracking station, click on bill then recover vessel
When you're on Kerbin (land or water), you can mouse over the altimeter at the top and a recover button will come down.

These suggestions are all terrible!!

What you do is build a vertical launch, vertical landing (but horizontal flying) Rapier engined jet craft. It should have enough aero things on it so it can float. On my craft the back of the engines are in water when it lands but they still work for take off. Decent is handled by parachute (or jet if you forget to repack them).

The only tricky part is the final maneuver where you sweep very low towards the target, then 800m out pull up into a vertical climb, when you start falling back deploy the chutes.

I can put up pics of mine if your interested.

2TheMun, the other 2 suggestions are the typical way we recover vessels and kerbals (and debris, even). Rus-Evo's way is just a fun alternate that would take a ton of time, effort and skill to perform.

I suggest you build a vertically oriented ship - something rocket-based, or a jet that can land facing up. Im thinking something VTOL might work nice too. Apply a radial intake or two to the top and bottom to ensure you'll always have sufficient air input. Just add a ladder, gently dip it in the ocean while avoiding it pitching over (so you might want to keep it small), and have your kerbal swim over :-).

Tips for a Jet-Boat-Thing:

Use powered wheels to drive off the runway, don't use the jets as you'll crash or take off (saying taking off is a bad thing... Weird). When you get in the water, then use your jets. Ones technique I heard of is to use girders with structural panels on the end as improvised water skis. Use a couple of raidal intakes on the top of the jet-thing to stop water getting in them, and use the basic jet, not the turbo jet. Try to keep the CoM low in the design, and try to keep the CoT slightly above the CoM to give you some downforce.

Also, don't go too fast. Bad things happen.
